content.body:
> <@dminor:mozilla.org> My colleague Sean Burke is interested in attending the meeting tomorrow. He's not yet an official Mozilla delegate, I wanted to double check there's no problem with him attending.

I believe it should be fine. Hasn't Sean attended previously as well? I feel like I remember them from a previous meeting but am not sure.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @dminor:mozilla.org
My colleague Sean Burke is interested in attending the meeting tomorrow. He's not yet an official Mozilla delegate, I wanted to double check there's no problem with him attending.
I believe it should be fine. Hasn't Sean attended previously as well? I feel like I remember them from a previous meeting but am not sure.

content.body: They were an observer at the last TC39 meeting as well, I'm not sure about TG2.
I think there's no issue on the TG2 side, and Mozilla has signed an org-wide IP release with ECMA so I see no reason why there might be issues
dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object
content.formatted_body: dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object

content.body: * dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object (they'd still need an onboarding issue but they can participate just like anyone else)
content.formatted_body: * dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object (they'd still need an onboarding issue but they can participate just like anyone else)

m.new_content.body: dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object (they'd still need an onboarding issue but they can participate just like anyone else)
m.new_content.formatted_body: dminor: technically any mozilla employee is automatically a delegate as long as the company POC doesn't object (they'd still need an onboarding issue but they can participate just like anyone else)

content.body: Well, Ecma does maintain a list of members of TCs and TGs (the word “delegate” is our invention) but the bottom line is it’s fine to participate
content.formatted_body: Well, Ecma does maintain a list of members of TCs and TGs (the word “delegate” is our invention) but the bottom line is it’s fine to participate

content.body: This is one of those not-100%-formal things which is sort of fine that way, as long as we eventually get good lists for reference
content.formatted_body: This is one of those not-100%-formal things which is sort of fine that way, as long as we eventually get good lists for reference
